text.0: send us a good and happy mind send energy and mental power.
text.1: thenat your glad carouselet men joy in thy love sweet juice as kine in pasture thou art waxing great.
text.2: rn all thy forms o soma rest thy powers that influence the heart.
text.3: so also these my longingsat your glad carousespread themselves seeking riches thou art waxing great.
text.4: even if o soma i neglect thy laws through my simplicity.
text.5: be graciousat your glad carouseas sire to son preserve us even from slaughter thou art waxing great.
text.6: our songs in concert go to thee as streams of water to the wells.
text.7: soma that we may live grantat your glad carousefull powers of mind like beakers thou art waxing great.
text.8: o soma through thy might who art skilful and strong these longing men.
text.9: these sages have thrown openat your glad carousethe stall of kine and horses thou art waxing great.
text.10: our herds thou guardest soma and the moving world spread far and wide.
text.11: thou fittest them for livingat your glad carouselooking upon all beings thou art waxing great.
text.12: on all sides soma be to us a guardian neer to be deceived.
text.13: king drive away our foemenat your glad carouselet not the wicked rule us thou art waxing great.
text.14: be watchful soma passing wise to give us store of vital strength.
text.15: more skilled than man to guide usat your glad carousesave us from harm and sorrow thou art waxing great.
text.16: chief slayer of our foemen thou indu art indras gracious friend.
text.17: when warriors invoke himat your glad carouse in fight to win them offspring thou art waxing great.
text.18: victorious is this gladdening drink to indra dear it grows in strength.
text.19: thisat your glad carouse enhanced the mighty hymn of the great sage kakṣīvān thou art waxing great.
text.20: this to the sage who offers gifts brings power that comes from wealth in kine.
text.21: this better than the seven hathat your glad carousefurthered the blind the cripple thou art waxing great.
